corrected_solution:
On Sunday he takes 2 hours to get there because 4 / 2 = 2
This takes him 120 minutes because 2 x 60 = 120
On Tuesday and Thursday, it takes him .4 hours to get to the store because 4 / 10 = .4
On Tuesday and Thursday, it takes him 24 minutes to get to the store because .4 x 60 = 24
In total it takes him 168 minutes to get to the store because 120 + 24 + 24 = 168
On average it takes him 56 minutes because 168 / 3 = 56
#### 56
corrected_explanation: Step 6 first erroneously counts Sunday, Tuesday, and Thursday as 4 days instead of 3 days, resulting in an error in the divisor in the formula. And step 6 calculates 168/4=42 instead of 168/3=56, resulting in the final incorrect answer.

corrected_solution:
On Sunday he takes 2 hours to get there because 4 / 2 = 2
This takes him 120 minutes because 2 x 60 = 120
On Tuesday and Thursday, it takes him .4 hours to get to the store because 4 / 10 = .4
On Tuesday and Thursday, it takes him 24 minutes to get to the store because .4 x 60 = 24
In total it takes him 168 minutes to get to the store because 120 + 24 + 24 = 168
On average it takes him 56 minutes because 168 / 3 = 56
#### 56
corrected_explanation: Step 6 first erroneously counts Sunday, Tuesday, and Thursday as 2 days instead of 3 days, resulting in an error in the divisor in the formula. And step 6 calculates 168/2=84 instead of 168/3=56, resulting in the final incorrect answer.
